summary: The Nonprofit Governance Integrity Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prevent certain foreign nationals from serving on the boards of directors of tax-exempt organizations. The bill prohibits citizens or nationals of "covered nations" (as defined elsewhere) from serving on boards of 501(c)(3) organizations (excluding churches), 501(c)(4) organizations, and 501(c)(6) organizations. This prohibition would apply to taxable years beginning after the Act's enactment.
